alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Laurel; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 05 at 6:32PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Laurel and Rockcastle. In southeast Kentucky, Jackson. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving showers and thunderstorms. Excessive runoff will cause minor flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lamero, Camp Wildcat, Mershons, Templer, Cruise, Eberle, Carico, Ardery, Middlefork, Parrot, Luner and Livingston.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
